00016 #include <stdlib.h>
00017 #include <stdio.h>

00019 #include <stdint.h>

00031 ya_t ya_literal(const char * restrict name, ya_type_t type, const void * restrict buf, size_t buf_size)
00032 {
00033     size_t aligned_buf_size = ya_align64(buf_size);
00034 
00035     ya_t r = {
00036         .type = type,
00037         .size = sizeof (ya_node_t) + aligned_buf_size,  // The outer size is the allocated size.
00038         .position = ya_previous_position,
00039     };
00040 
00041     // Allocate memory aligned to 32 bit. We need to use calloc so that we don't accidently
00042     // leak information into the output file.
00043     r.node = calloc(1, r.size);
00044     r.node->name             = htonll(ya_create_name(name));
00045     r.node->size             = htonll(sizeof (ya_node_t) + aligned_buf_size);  // The inner length is the length of header+data.
00046     r.node->type             = r.type;
00047     r.node->position.file    = htonl(r.position.file);
00048     r.node->position.line    = htonl(r.position.line);
00049     r.node->position.column  = htonl(r.position.column);
00050 
00051     memcpy(r.node->data, buf, buf_size);
00052     // Set padding bytes to zero, so as not to leak data. For security purposes.
00053     memset(&r.node->data[buf_size], 0, aligned_buf_size - buf_size);
00054     return r;
00055 }

00057 
00058 typedef union {
00059     double      d;
00060     uint64_t    u;
00061     int64_t     i;
00062 } translate_t;
00063 
00064 ya_t ya_binary_float(const char * restrict name, const char * restrict buf, size_t buf_size, int base, int nr_bits)
00065 {
00066     translate_t t;
00067     char        *endptr;
00068 
00069     t.d = strtold(buf, &endptr);
00070     if (buf == endptr) {
00071         ya_error("Could not convert real value '%s'", buf);
00072     }
00073 
00074     if ((t.d == HUGE_VALL || t.d == -HUGE_VALL) && errno == ERANGE) {
00075         ya_error("Could not convert real value '%s', overflow", buf);
00076     }
00077 
00078     if ((t.d == 0.0 || t.d == -0.0) && errno == ERANGE) {
00079         ya_error("Could not convert real value '%s', underflow", buf);
00080     }
00081 
00082     t.u = htonll(t.u);
00083     return ya_literal(name, YA_NODE_TYPE_BINARY_FLOAT, &t.u, sizeof (t.u));
00084 }
00085 
00086 ya_t ya_integer(const char * restrict name, ya_type_t type, const char * restrict buf, size_t buf_size, int base)
00087 {
00088     int                 i = 0;
00089     char                c;
00090     uint128_t           value;
00091     uint128_t           value128;
00092     uint64_t            value64;
00093     int                 digit;
00094 
00095     value = 0;
00096     for (i = 0; i < buf_size; i++) {
00097         c = buf[i];
00098 
00099         if (base == 32) {
00100             // RFC 4648, Base-32
00101             if      (c >= 'a' && c <= 'z')  { digit = c - 'a';      }
00102             else if (c >= 'A' && c <= 'Z')  { digit = c - 'A';      }
00103             else if (c >= '2' && c <= '7')  { digit = c - '2' + 26; }
00104             else                            { digit = base;         }
00105 
00106         } else if (base >= 37 && base <= 64) {
00107             // RFC 4648, Base-64
00108             if      (c >= 'A' && c <= 'Z')  { digit = c - 'A';      }
00109             else if (c >= 'a' && c <= 'z')  { digit = c - 'a' + 26; }
00110             else if (c >= '0' && c <= '9')  { digit = c - '0' + 52; }
00111             else if (c == '+'            )  { digit = 62;           }
00112             else if (c == '/'            )  { digit = 63;           }
00113             else                            { digit = base;         }
00114 
00115         } else if (base >= 0 && base <= 36) {
00116             // RFC 4648, Base-16
00117             if      (c >= '0' && c <= '9')  { digit = c - '0';      }
00118             else if (c >= 'A' && c <= 'Z')  { digit = c - 'A' + 10; }
00119             else if (c >= 'a' && c <= 'z')  { digit = c - 'a' + 10; }
00120             else                            { digit = base;         }
00121 
00122         } else {
00123             fprintf(stderr, "ya_integer does not implement a base above 64.\n");
00124             abort();
00125         }
00126 
00127         if (digit < base) {
00128             // Only characters inside the alphabet are processed, all other characters are ignored.
00129             value *= base;
00130             if (value + digit < value) {
00131                 ya_error("Overflow of integer literal");
00132             }
00133             value += digit;
00134         }
00135     }
00136 
00137     if (value <= UINT64_MAX) {
00138         value64 = htonll(value);
00139         return ya_literal(name, type, &value64, sizeof(value64));
00140     } else {
00141         value128 = htonlll(value);
00142         return ya_literal(name, type, &value128, sizeof(value128));
00143     }
00144 }
00145 
00146 ya_t ya_text(const char * restrict name, const char * restrict buf, size_t buf_size)
00147 {
00148     return ya_literal(name, YA_NODE_TYPE_TEXT, buf, buf_size);
00149 }
00150 
00151 ya_t ya_leaf(const char * restrict name)
00152 {
00153     return ya_literal(name, YA_NODE_TYPE_LEAF, NULL, 0);
00154 }
00155 
00156 ya_t ya_null(void)
00157 {
00158     return ya_literal("#null", YA_NODE_TYPE_NULL, NULL, 0);
00159 }
00160 
00161 ya_t ya_positive_integer(const char * restrict name, const char * restrict buf, size_t buf_size, int base)
00162 {
00163     return ya_integer(name, YA_NODE_TYPE_POSITIVE_INTEGER, buf, buf_size, base);
00164 }
00165 
00166 ya_t ya_negative_integer(const char * restrict name, const char * restrict buf, size_t buf_size, int base)
00167 {
00168     return ya_integer(name, YA_NODE_TYPE_NEGATIVE_INTEGER, buf, buf_size, base);
00169 }
